title: Butter Chicken
cooking_method: Marinate chicken pieces with ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, and a pinch of salt. Let it sit for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a pan and cook the marinated chicken until it turns white.
Add tomato puree, cream, and salt. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

title: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: Fresh mint and coriander leaves for garnish
cooking_method: Cook basmati rice and keep aside.
In a large pan, sauté sliced onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute.
Add assorted vegetables, yogurt, biryani masala, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Layer cooked rice and vegetable mixture. Sprinkle saffron strands and garnish with mint and coriander leaves.
Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.

title: Chole Bhature
cooking_method: Pressure cook chickpeas until tender. Drain and keep aside.
Prepare a dough using all-purpose flour, yogurt, and water. Let it rest for 2 hours.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, ginger-garlic paste, and sauté.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, and cooked chickpeas. Cook for 10 minutes.
Roll out the dough into puris and deep fry. Serve with chole and garnish with coriander leaves.

title: Palak Paneer
cooking_method: Heat butter in a pan, add cumin seeds, and sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute.
Add spinach puree, cream, garam masala, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add cubed paneer and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.
